Instead of trying to discount cars to consumers, they've been selling fleet, probably the best of tricky choices. Sergio Marchionne has been working to pull back incentive spending since taking over the company in 2009. Fiat gained a 20 percent ownership stake in Chrysler when the U.S. automaker emerged from bankruptcy in June 2009.

of the Egyptian special forces stands guard on the main floor of the Egyptian Museum.( Todras-Whitehill/AP) Zahi Hawass said that many protesters helped to defend the museum from looters. he told The Washington Post. They know this museum is their cultural heritage. This could have been the blackest day of my life, but thank God, we are protecting the sites. Egyptian protesters, some wielding billy clubs, formed a human chain at the museum's front gate to prevent looters from making off with any of its priceless artifacts. "Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!" , poking fun at his blog post. The latter explained that he, Larry Page and other co-founder Sergei Brin no longer needed to guide the company as a trio: So Larry Page , Sergey and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making-- and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured. Larry Page will take over Eric Schmidt 's job on April 4. Eric Schmidt will become the company's executive chairman, working on Google's relationships with other companies. for playing Sylvester in the hit US TV Show, also went on to claim that despite various campaigns, Glee villain Sue could never join SiCo on the US X Factor judging panel. Jane Lynch explained: People have asked me,` What about having Sue on The X Factor? How would she do?' I think she'd be fantastic- and there would be a few contestants reduced to tears. "It can never happen, though. Simon Cowell and Sue on the same judging panel will never work in a million years- there's only room for one ego on the show!"
